heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 22 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 10th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 6 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 18 October 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (210°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.4°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 104 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.9°C), feels like temperature (up 4.6°C), cloud levels (up 388 m), and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 104.2m lower than yesterday, 78.8m lower than the past week, 388.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 706m minimum and 2390m maximum, with an average of 1050.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1129.6m and 1439.2m.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.3°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
